2022-10-02T15:49:13Z: And that's all from us, thanks for sticking with us through all of the delays! We'll be back next week for the Japanese Grand Prix at Suzuka at...WHAT TIME? There's a 4 o'clock in the morning now? Please bring me coffee.
2022-10-02T15:47:03Z: Here's the full race report from a manic Singapore Grand Prix: https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/f1-singapore-gp-perez-wins-from-leclerc-verstappen-settles-for-seventh/10378320/
2022-10-02T15:23:58Z: A test of endurance today. And a test, also, of endurance for our F1 reporter Luke Smith - who's been running the London Marathon. You can donate to his sterling efforts right here: https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/lukesmithlondon2022
2022-10-02T15:18:39Z: The drivers get their deli tickets after getting weight. Who's having the pastrami on rye?
2022-10-02T15:12:46Z: It's Stroll in sixth from Verstappen, with Vettel, Hamilton and Gasly to complete the top 10.
2022-10-02T15:12:14Z: Leclerc and Sainz will flank him on the podium, with second and third. And it's a good day for McLaren, as Norris and Ricciardo complete the top five.
2022-10-02T15:11:25Z: And Sergio Perez (probably) wins the 2022 Singapore Grand Prix!
2022-10-02T15:11:22Z: And Verstappen does get Vettel on the final lap to take seventh place!
2022-10-02T15:10:26Z: Verstappen hasn't given up on seventh place - and he has one lap left to find a way ahead of Vettel.
2022-10-02T15:10:20Z: It's the final lap now, and Perez is 7.3s up the road from Leclerc.
2022-10-02T15:09:03Z: Make that over five seconds as Leclerc's had a bit of a poor lap. Perez looks to have one more lap to do this.
2022-10-02T15:08:43Z: Hamilton looks at a move up the inside on Vettel but moves on to the damp stuff and gets it all wrong, allowing Verstappen the easiest overtake of his evening.
2022-10-02T15:07:11Z: Leclerc's dropped to 4.2s behind Perez, which is good news for the Red Bull driver - just in case a safety car-related penalty comes his way.
2022-10-02T15:06:09Z: Vettel vs Hamilton vs Verstappen. This Singapore GP is giving the fans what they want. OK, it is for seventh, but it is still very exciting.
2022-10-02T15:03:50Z: Hamilton is gaining DRS from Vettel ahead of him so he's able to keep Verstappen at bay, but for how long?
2022-10-02T15:02:45Z: Verstappen has caught Hamilton so the fight for eighth place is on. Which wasn't something we expected to state going into this race.
2022-10-02T15:01:31Z: Russell pits, but not to retire, as he takes on fresh softs for the run to the finish. Not really sure why, apart from having some fun and trying to get the fastest lap while down in 14th place.
2022-10-02T15:00:21Z: F1's data loggers predict Verstappen will catch Hamilton in two laps, which will give him six minutes of the race left to overtake him. Race laps to race time conversion is the new currency to deal in. It's probably stronger than the pound.
2022-10-02T14:58:35Z: The battle at the front has rather petered out a bit as Leclerc's struggled to recover his momentum. Norris, too, sits about 3s behind Sainz - but he's well ahead of team-mate Ricciardo in fifth.
2022-10-02T14:57:24Z: And just like that, Verstappen is in ninth place. He's got 12 minutes of the race to go to catch Hamilton who is 4.7s ahead.
2022-10-02T14:56:11Z: Verstappen is back into the points, as he gets by Bottas for 10th, and is already on the gearbox of Gasly.
2022-10-02T14:55:56Z: Safety car incident involving Perez will be investigated after the race. An odd decision, but we move.
2022-10-02T14:52:47Z: Leclerc went too deep into Turn 14 on the previous lap and sheds a second to Perez - so he's got to crack back on with it to address the arrears. It's lap 49 now, with about 16 minutes on the clock.
2022-10-02T14:51:20Z: Hamilton, another trying to recover positions, is in eighth stuck behind old foe Vettel.
2022-10-02T14:50:08Z: Verstappen makes light work of getting by Magnussen to move up to 11th. Next up is Bottas who is 7.7s up the road.
2022-10-02T14:48:28Z: Leclerc's pressuring Perez though, who locks up into Turn 13. Great scrap so far.
2022-10-02T14:48:15Z: Verstappen's pace is red hot, he's half a second faster than the leaders, and has cut the gap to Magnussen from 10s to 1s in two and a bit laps.
2022-10-02T14:47:20Z: Leclerc starts lap 46 with a run at Perez, but the straight isn't long enough to make a DRS pass. He has another look into Turn 7, but he's just not quite close enough...
2022-10-02T14:47:13Z: No further investigation on the Russell vs Schumacher clash from earlier. The stewards have been busy enough this evening.
2022-10-02T14:45:19Z: Meanwhile, Norris is up on Sainz in a battle for third, the golfing buddies trading swings on track. I don't know how golf works.
2022-10-02T14:44:22Z: Verstappen, for the second time in this race, is starting a climb up the order as he puts in a new fastest lap of 1m51.370s. He's got a 10s gap to bridge until he catches Magnussen ahead.
2022-10-02T14:44:15Z: Leclerc had a look with DRS, now that it's active, but Perez is able to find a little bit of pace to keep the Ferrari at bay.
2022-10-02T14:42:06Z: It appears to be just punctures for Schumacher and Russell as both rejoin the action on soft tyres. So it is Verstappen 12th, Schumacher 13th and Russell 14th.
2022-10-02T14:40:29Z: Schumacher has also come to a crawl and is limping back to the pits along with Russell. That could be both their races over.
2022-10-02T14:39:35Z: Leclerc's right on Perez's tail now, having done a 1m53.302s on the previous lap.
2022-10-02T14:39:04Z: TV replays catch Russell bash wheels with Schumacher going into Turn 1 and that gave the Mercedes driver an instant puncture.
2022-10-02T14:38:01Z: Safety car infringement noted for Perez - will that get investigated?
2022-10-02T14:37:58Z: Verstappen duly pits and comes out in last place, but not for long as Russell has a puncture and is going very slowly.
2022-10-02T14:36:40Z: Verstappen tries a move on Norris into Turn 5, but locks his tyres up massively and goes into the run-off! He drops to eighth, just ahead of Hamilton.
2022-10-02T14:36:23Z: Russell, who has had an eventful race like a few others, takes two places at the restart on Magnussen and Bottas to move up to 12th place.
2022-10-02T14:35:39Z: Perez kicks us off again! He stays ahead of Leclerc, as Norris has Verstappen all over him.
2022-10-02T14:33:32Z: The safety car will be in at the end of this lap - lap 39.
2022-10-02T14:31:48Z: The TV graphics have switched from the lap counter to a countdown timer. So there's 37 minutes left in this race, or 23 laps, whatever comes first.
2022-10-02T14:27:37Z: Norris takes the opportunity to pit under the safety car, and comes back out in fourth place - just behind Sainz. Ricciardo pits too, taking on the soft tyre and comes out behind Verstappen.
2022-10-02T14:26:30Z: Tsunoda, who had just pitted for dry tyres remember, locked up into Turn 10 and slid into the outside wall head-on. He's out of the car, all OK, and off for an early bath.
2022-10-02T14:25:07Z: It is a full safety car this time to recover the car and repair the barrier.
2022-10-02T14:24:38Z: Another car in the wall! This time it is Tsunoda who has crashed at Turn 10.
2022-10-02T14:24:07Z: Perez comes in at the end of lap 36 for his own slick-tyre stop, as does Sainz. Leclerc's stop was marginally slow, as he slid into the pitbox. Verstappen also comes in.
2022-10-02T14:24:03Z: Hamilton comes out in ninth place and is three seconds behind Vettel.
2022-10-02T14:23:05Z: There's a 1m56.177s for Russell, underlining the slick tyre pace now.
2022-10-02T14:21:57Z: And here comes Charles Leclerc to pick up the slicks! He was told earlier to do the opposite of Perez, and he's collected some medium tyres. Hamilton duly does the same, plus new front wing.
2022-10-02T14:21:52Z: A lap later Tsunoda, Bottas and Magnussen all pit for dry tyres. Here we go, time for the pit crews to do their thing.
2022-10-02T14:21:04Z: Gasly is the second driver to pit for slicks just as Russell puts in a 1m57s - matching the leaders. It is now time for slicks.
2022-10-02T14:19:37Z: Hamilton's gone into the wall! He goes too deep at Turn 7, backs it out of the barrier, and returns to the track right in between Norris and Verstappen!
2022-10-02T14:18:10Z: In short, it still isn't time for slicks, but it is very close and will require some bravery.
2022-10-02T14:17:05Z: Soft tyre watch: Russell, who has needed to move aside due to blue flags, is starting to light up the timing screen in some mini sectors. But overall he's slower because he's losing so much time in the wet final sector.
2022-10-02T14:16:18Z: Leclerc's just hacked a second out of Perez's lead, posting a 1m56.259s. Mistake for Perez, or is Leclerc finding time?
2022-10-02T14:14:36Z: A moment for Verstappen, where he tried to anticipate the end of the VSC and had to get on the brakes to avoid passing Norris too soon. A bit over-eager there.
2022-10-02T14:12:28Z: Off we go again, back to green flag racing!
2022-10-02T14:10:38Z: Ferrari's pitcrew is left hanging for a stop, as neither Leclerc nor Sainz fancy coming in. Inter-slicks are still the way to go here.
2022-10-02T14:10:25Z: Not a day for the teams in blue - double DNFs for Alpine and Williams. Two engine blows for the French squad and two crashes for the British team.
2022-10-02T14:07:26Z: Now Ocon has stopped on the track! He's got a smoking car - double disaster for Alpine!
2022-10-02T14:05:56Z: Albon makes it back to the pits but suffers the same fate as his Williams team-mate Latifi from earlier, as the mechanics call time on his race due to the damage.
2022-10-02T14:04:35Z: A 1m58.161s for Perez on the previous lap before the VSC, who is now 3s clear of Leclerc. Still no takers for a pitstop under the yellow flag period.
2022-10-02T14:04:09Z: Another virtual safety car is used so the track marshals can clear up Albon's discarded front wing from the track.
2022-10-02T14:03:19Z: Albon has crashed! He's lost his front wing in the wall but has managed to get going again.
2022-10-02T14:02:19Z: Next time around, Russell puts in a 2m05s so is gaining time, but he's way off the pace still.
2022-10-02T14:00:33Z: Guinea pig Russell puts in a 2m09.869s on his first clear lap which is six seconds per lap slower than Albon who is next up the road. He’s gone too early.
2022-10-02T13:58:59Z: Alonso's retirement has massively helped Verstappen out, and he's now in free air and closing Norris down after doing a 1m58.377s.
2022-10-02T13:56:38Z: Brown flag for Russell, big slide out of the first corner and he manages to keep it out of the wall.
2022-10-02T13:55:53Z: Slick tyre gamble klaxon! It is Russell, who didn't have much to lose in 16th place, as he puts on the mediums. He's instantly slipping and sliding around coming out of the pits.
2022-10-02T13:54:49Z: Alonso appears to lose power instantly and has to pull off the track at Turn 10. His 350th F1 race won't be one to remember.
2022-10-02T13:54:26Z: Nobody's opting for a stop under this VSC so far among the front runners, looking to keep track position.
2022-10-02T13:53:40Z: Alonso has stopped with an engine issue! That releases Verstappen into sixth place, as a virtual safety car is called.
2022-10-02T13:50:45Z: “Massive lag on the upshift,” Verstappen warns over team radio.
2022-10-02T13:50:15Z: A 1m58.717s for Perez on that lap, extending his lead over Leclerc to 2s. Sainz is a further 10s back.
2022-10-02T13:50:11Z: Verstappen clearly has the pace in clean air, just look at how get caught up to Alonso, but given the track characteristics coupled with the damp conditions, trying to find a way to overtake is proving very difficult.
2022-10-02T13:46:51Z: Sharing Verstappen's problem is Russell, who still cannot find a way ahead of Bottas. The Mercedes driver remains down in 16th place.
2022-10-02T13:45:40Z: Norris says that the tyres are becoming more slick, with more grip on the dry bits but slippier on the damper parts of the circuit. Not dissimilar to Turkey 2020, when Hamilton kept life in his slicktermediates to win.
2022-10-02T13:45:32Z: Verstappen's Alonso blockage is losing him vital time that was handed back to him by the earlier safety car. He's still stuck behind the Alpine and is almost a full pitstop worth of time behind the leaders.
2022-10-02T13:41:50Z: Perez is 1.7s up on Leclerc, adding little bits to his lead over Leclerc with each lap. He was 0.3s quicker than Leclerc on lap 15, as both protagonists are trying to keep tyres cool.
2022-10-02T13:40:46Z: The stewards will take no further action on the Verstappen vs Magnussen clash from the opening lap, so both can breathe easier. Verstappen, though, is still stuck behind Alonso who is putting in a defensive masterclass.
2022-10-02T13:36:35Z: The Dutch driver is already right behind Alonso, looking to continue his charge. You feel it is only a matter of time.
2022-10-02T13:35:23Z: Perez the first man into the 1m59s, with a 1m59.580s on the restart. Hamilton, however, reckons Perez backed the pack up before the lights went out on the safety car.
2022-10-02T13:34:07Z: But could trouble follow for Verstappen? His clash with Magnussen from the opening lap is being investigated. The stewards are also looking into the Zhou vs Latifi clash that took both of them out of the race.
2022-10-02T13:33:02Z: Verstappen isn't hanging about now, as he gets by Gasly later on in the lap and is up to seventh.
2022-10-02T13:32:37Z: Verstappen gets Vettel at Turn 5 on the safety car restart to move up to eighth place. A smart move by the Dutch driver.
2022-10-02T13:32:25Z: And we're back! Perez gets away well, as Hamilton goes with Sainz in his overtures for third.
2022-10-02T13:29:20Z: Safety car will come in at the end of lap 10 - so, this lap.
2022-10-02T13:29:04Z: It's all been going on. Before the safety car Russell tried a move on Bottas but clipped his back-right wheel on to the Finn's front wing. Both avoid any serious damage as Russell took to the run-off.
2022-10-02T13:27:35Z: Latifi makes it back to the pits but the damage to his car looks terminal. The mechanics at the back-left wheel wave their arms around with the new tyre wobbling around. That's his race run.
2022-10-02T13:27:29Z: The safety car has picked up the right car this time, so that's reassuring. Sainz and Hamilton are on the back of the train behind Perez and Leclerc, with Norris catching up.
2022-10-02T13:25:13Z: They did indeed clash! Zhou, looking for space around the outside of Latifi at Turn 5, gets squeezed into the wall and the contact breaks his front-right corner. The safety car has been deployed.
2022-10-02T13:23:36Z: Has there been a clash between Zhou and Latifi? The Chinese driver has stopped on track at Turn 5 and Latifi has a puncture and is limping back to the pits.
2022-10-02T13:22:39Z: Magnussen has been shown the black and orange flag, not for the first time this season, so he'll need to pit to fix the damage to his car. The Dane is currently running in 12th.
2022-10-02T13:21:53Z: Norris, meanwhile, reports that the circuit isn't drying up particularly quickly. He's still fifth, about 6s behind Hamilton but 3.6s clear of Alonso.
2022-10-02T13:21:38Z: Verstappen is staring at Vettel's rear wing but can't find a way through. He'll need to quickly if he wants to fight for the podium because he's losing almost three seconds per lap to Perez and co.
2022-10-02T13:21:05Z: Leclerc now does a 2m00.219s to cut the arrears slightly to Perez, but the Red Bull driver is going slightly quicker so far on lap 6.
2022-10-02T13:18:54Z: The other climber through the field is Russell following his pitlane start. He's already up to 17th, getting up the inside of Latifi at Turn 14.
2022-10-02T13:17:46Z: Perez has unlocked a bit of pace, gapping Leclerc by an extra 0.4s on lap 4 to extend his lead to 1.3s. Sainz is another five seconds down the road.
2022-10-02T13:16:46Z: The F1 world championship leader is continuing his climb up the order as he gets ahead of Tsunoda for ninth place. Next up for him is Vettel.
2022-10-02T13:15:44Z: Verstappen, who took to the inside of Turn 1 at the start, will not be put under investigation by the stewards for gaining an advantage at the start. He did lose places after all, even if it was cheeky.
2022-10-02T13:15:25Z: Lap 3, and Leclerc is glued to the back of Perez. Hamilton, meanwhile, says he has no grip on the intermediate rubber.
2022-10-02T13:12:48Z: Verstappen is getting his elbows out now and gets by Magnussen and Stroll in quick succession to move up to 10th on lap two.
2022-10-02T13:11:59Z: On the opening lap at Turn 7 there's a tangle between the backmarkers as Albon is spun off into the run-off area. He gets going again but is in last place.
2022-10-02T13:11:53Z: Norris got ahead of Alonso at the start, as the Alpine driver was forced to defend from Gasly.
2022-10-02T13:10:54Z: Verstappen has a really poor start off the line, loses a handful of places and is down to 12th place!
2022-10-02T13:10:11Z: The 2022 Singapore Grand Prix is go! Perez gets away and gets the lead down the inside! Hamilton is wide at Turn 1 and that lets Sainz into third!
2022-10-02T13:05:22Z: And after an hour (and a bit)'s wait, the formation lap is away!
2022-10-02T12:56:52Z: 10 minutes to go, and a reminder of your front few grid spots: It's Leclerc from Perez, Hamilton from Sainz, Alonso from Norris, Gasly from Verstappen, and Magnussen from Tsunoda. Russell starts from the pitlane after an engine change.
